thread.title: 'Sherlock' trailer; Rick Moranis may act again; 'Old Yeller' actor dies: AM Buzz
thread.title_full: 'Sherlock' trailer; Rick Moranis may act again; 'Old Yeller' actor dies: AM Buzz | syracuse.com

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: 'Sherlock' trailer; Rick Moranis may act again; 'Old Yeller' actor dies: AM Buzz
text:
Benedict Cumberbatch is back as "Sherlock" for a Christmas special that throws it back to Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Victorian times. The first trailer shows the world's most famous detective and John Watson (Martin Freeman) in 1800's garb for the one-off followup to three seasons of the BBC series. A full fourth season is expected to return the pair to a modern setting, but for now this old school Holmes will have to hold us over. Look for it in December on the BBC, and in January on PBS.
Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson and Sigourney Weaver will all make cameos in Paul Feig's upcoming all-female "Ghostbusters" reboot, but not Rick Moranis . The 62-year-old actor said a cameo as geeky Louis Tully made "no sense," but he hopes the new movie is "terrific." Moranis went on hiatus when his wife died of cancer in 1997 to raise their two children, but he says he's not retired and may act again -- but he's "picky" after making classics like "Spaceballs," "Strange Brew" and "Little Shop of Horrors." He told THR: "I'm surprised that Disney hasn't done 'Honey, I Shrunk the Grandkids.'"
» Read more at the New York Daily News .
"Old Yeller" actor Kevin Corcoran is dead at the age of 66, his wife Laura announced Wednesday. The former child star had been battling colorectal cancer for five years when he died Tuesday at a California hospital. Corcoran played Arliss, Jim's youngest son in the 1957 movie about a heroic dog, and then turned to producing after college. His credits include Disney's "Return From Witch Mountain," TV's "Sons of Anarchy" and "The Shield." He's survived by his wife of 43 years and four siblings.
» Read more at E! News .
TMZ reports John Stamos will be charged with driving under the influence of GHB, better known as "the date rape drug." Sources tell the celebrity gossip site he was using the drug as a fitness supplement to "lean out body mass" for his new TV show, "Grandfathered." The 52-year-old actor went to rehab after being arrested in June for driving erratically in Beverly Hills; charges are expected to be filed soon.
» Read more at TMZ .
And after four films, Daniel Craig calls playing James Bond "a drag." The 47-year-old actor says "it's a struggle" to worry about how he looks as 007, when he'd rather focus on performing. When asked if he'd play the British spy again after "Spectre," he said it wouldn't be anytime soon: "I'd rather break this glass and slash my wrists," Craig said. "I'm over it at the moment. We're done. All I want to do is move on."
» Read more at ET .
